docs.snippet: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton accused Donald Trump on Sunday of scapegoating the parents of a Muslim soldier killed in Iraq, after the Republican nominee took issue with remarks the soldier's father made at the Democratic ...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton accused Donald Trump on Sunday of scapegoating the parents of a Muslim soldier killed in Iraq, after the Republican nominee took issue with remarks the soldier's father made at the Democratic National Convention.

headline.main: Clinton Accuses Trump of Scapegoating Muslim Soldier's Parents

docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes Donald Trump for his refusal to release his full income tax returns, something that no major party candidate has refused to do since 1976.

docs.snippet: Billionaire investor Warren Buffett on Monday campaigned alongside U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton at a rowdy rally in his home state of Nebraska, where he challenged Republican Donald Trump to release his tax returns and qu...
docs.lead_paragraph: Billionaire investor Warren Buffett on Monday campaigned alongside U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton at a rowdy rally in his home state of Nebraska, where he challenged Republican Donald Trump to release his tax returns and questioned Trump's business acumen.

headline.main: Buffett Rebukes Trump, Questions His Business Skill
headline.print_headline: Buffett Rebukes Trump, Questions His Business Skill

docs.snippet: Mr. Trump said of Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin, “He’s not going into Ukraine,” then was informed that Russia was already there. “O.K., well, he’s there in a certain way,” Mr. Trump replied....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump said of Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin, “He’s not going into Ukraine,” then was informed that Russia was already there. “O.K., well, he’s there in a certain way,” Mr. Trump replied.
docs.abstract: Donald Trump gives confused statement of his views of Russian annexation of Crimea in 2014 in interview with George Stephanopoulos on news program This Week; says Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin would not direct his forces to go into Ukraine if he becomes president, and offers fractured response to Stephanopoulos when it is pointed out Russian troops have been in Ukraine for two years.

headline.main: Donald Trump Gives Questionable Explanation of Events in Ukraine
headline.print_headline: Trump Tripped Up on Ukraine and Putin

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MAGGIE HABERMAN
